Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Acceptable Uncertainty in Skipping Intravenous Thrombolysis Before Endovascular Treatment

Intervention.evidence: comparing IVT+EVT (standard care) with EVT alone (experimental arm)

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the acceptable level of uncertainty for omitting intravenous thrombolysis (IVT) before endovascular treatment (EVT) in stroke patients directly admitted to EVT-capable centers.

Method_Outcome.evidence: where both arms achieved similar functional independence at 90 days

Result_Outcome.evidence: Interventionalists selected higher margins (aOR 2.20, 95% CI 1.06 to 4.67)
